cork: A small cork plug. Crafted from rubbery tree bark; it can be used t' contain liquids in bottles and other containers.
glassBottleOfSeawater: Filled t' th' top with seawater. While seawater be technically drinkable, it will not reduce yer thirst.
glassBottleOfDesalinatedWater: A bottle filled with clear seawater that has been processed t' remove th' salt content.
glassBottleOfMedicinalWater: A bottled concoction o' herbs and nutrients. Used t' cure thirst, poisons, and other ailments.
glassBottleOfPurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle o' purified fresh water
Potable, and safe t' hydrate yerself with. Th' water has been purified reducin' some godforsaken toxins and unsafe bacteria.
glassBottleOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: glass bottle o' unpurified fresh water
A bottle containin' water that be likely unfit t' drink. It will quench yer thirst, but may have negative side-effects until it's purified.
wroughtIronArrow: An arrow with a wrought iron arrowhead. Th' shaft o' th' arrow be lon' and be fletched with feathers.
ironArrow: An arrow tipped with a high-quality iron arrowhead. Fletched with feathers t' stabilize flight and accuracy.
stoneBullet: A basic stone projectile fer slings and firearms. Smooth and more or less spherical in shape.
wroughtIronBullet: A small ball o' wrought iron, used as ammunition fer slingshots or firearms.
ironBullet: A stron', forged iron bullet. Used as slin' or firearm ammunition.
leatherQuiver: A leather-bound, back-mounted container designed t' hold arrows; however, other items will also fit inside as well.
ectoplasm: A ghostly, weightless fluff o' misty goo, strangely self-contained and smartly evaporatin'.
magicalEssence: An odd transparent powder with organic and ethereal materials. This magical matter may be used on items t' affix magical properties on t' them.
woodenFence: A section o' wooden fencin', constructed from two logs and held together with horizontal beams.
creatureIdol: A mass o' animal organs, crudely shaped into some kind o' figure. It smells awful and emits an odd hummin' noise, and appears t' attract creatures.
cordedSling: Several pieces o' strin', wrapped and bound with a slot made fer a projectile. Used t' swin' ammunition, increasin' throwin' range.
leatherSling: A slin' crafted from tanned leather. Designed t' hold a projectile t' be thrown at an increased velocity.
wroughtIronArrowhead: Forged with wrought iron, this arrowhead be used t' craft an arrow. In dire need, it could also be used fer carvin'.
ironArrowhead: An expertly forged iron arrowhead, used t' create arrows. Alternatively, can be used t' carve if necessary.
hammock: A comfortable place t' sleep while hun' off th' ground, although not too sturdy. Crafted by bound strin' and rope.
cottonBedroll: A soft and downy sleepin' mattress, rolled up fer ease o' carryin'. Can be used t' sleep or rest very comfortably.
featherBedroll: A bedroll made with soft feathers and wrapped in fabric. Used fer restin' and sleepin' in comfort.
rawTaintedMeat: A piece o' bad-smellin' meat, possibly diseased or tainted with parasites. Possible t' consume, but could be deadly.
cookedTaintedMeat: A piece o' discolored meat, cooked t' kill possible toxins, but possibly still unsafe fer consumption.
stoneKnife: A sharpened piece o' stone actin' as blade and socketed into a carved handle and wrapped with strin' fer support. Can be used as a weapon, gatherin' tool or t' carve.
rawBlindfish: An odd-lookin' fish with no eyes. Very slimy t' th' touch.
cookedBlindfish: While th' source o' th' food be a bit suspect, after bein' cooked, it appears t' be more palatable.
pemmican: A ball o' dried ground meat. With a lon' shelf life, this be th' ultimate survival food. Fer th' best benefits, prepare it with animal fat.
cookedPemmican: A seasoned mound o' dried ground meat, fried and cooked with fat fer maximum flavor and caloric content.
sail: A large piece o' fabric, woven together t' be attached t' a mast. Used on a sailboat t' propel it alon' th' sea.
sailboat: A large one-man boat. Used t' traverse large expanses o' water and fer travel back t' civilization.
chickenEgg: A brown colored egg, laid by a cackle. Can be eaten as is, or cooked fer a tastier meal.
boiledChickenEgg: A moist, delicious boiled egg. Great tastin' and packed with protein.
sheafOfHay: Lon' and almost sharp t' th' touch. These grass stalks be perfect fer strin' makin', animal feed, or tinder when dried.
niter: A natural mineral, ground up t' be used as a preservative or fer other chemical applications.
saltpeter: A ground mineral, t' be used as a natural food preservative. If combined with other minerals, it can be combustible.
blackPowder: A highly combustible powder, made up o' a combination o' minerals.
flintlockPistol: A lon' range, high damage pistol. Requires black powder and bullets t' fire.
giblets: A batch o' cooked animal organs. Considerably repugnant, but nutritious and fillin'.
explosiveTrap: A mound o' leaves used t' conceal a volatile explosive powder. Steppin' on it will trigger a small explosion.
skeletalMageWand: A mysterious, gnarled staff with a twinklin' red gemstone attached t' th' end.
rawClayJug: A formed and sculpted jug molded from raw clay. Requires a cork and a kiln t' be fired and hardened.
clayJug: A fully hardened clay jug with a cork. Used t' hold water.
clayJugOfSeawater: Unfiltered seawater, held in a clay jug. Unsuitable t' drink in its current form but could be desalinated.
clayJugOfDesalinatedWater: Potable, safe-to-drink water. Th' water in this clay jug has gone through th' desalination process.
clayJugOfMedicinalWater: A clay jug containin' medicinal water, used t' cure and soothe certain ailments while also replenishin' yer thirst.
clayJugOfPurifiedFreshWater: clay jug o' purified fresh water
A clay jug filled with fresh, purified water. Can be used t' quench yer thirst.
clayJugOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: clay jug o' unpurified fresh water
A clay jug full o' natural, fresh water. Although it be drinkable, further purification be recommended.
rawClayBrick: A soft piece o' raw clay, molded into a rectangle. Ready t' be fired inside a kiln.
clayBrick: A hardened clay brick, used in th' buildin' o' structures such as floors and walls.
clayWall: A wall made from clay bricks, set into a typical skewed, grid-like fashion t' increase durability.
clayFlooring: Floorin' crafted from clay bricks. Could be used as decoration or as part o' a buildin'.
pineappleSeeds: Small brown seeds that can be planted t' grow into pineapple plants.
pricklyPearSeeds: These appear t' be prickly pear seeds. Can be planted t' grow cacti or eaten.
clematisSeeds: Seeds t' grow clematis. Can be eaten if desperate, but they do not contain any significant nutrition.
paperSheet: A large piece o' paper. It appears t' contain many recycled fibers. Suitable fer drawin' on with ink.
paperMold: A mold used fer makin' paper. Contains a screen that holds wet recycled fibers t' dry and press into flattened, usable paper.
beggarticks: Th' flower and stems o' beggarticks. Only useful in creatin' medicinal tonics, or ingestin' directly if food supply be low.
milkThistleFlowers: Th' flowerin' bulbs o' a milk thistle plant. Filled with a bitter but nutritious milk.
drawnMap: A paper sheet, scrawled with geographical landmarks and features. Used t' approximate a location when read.
tatteredClothShirt: A once fine piece o' clothin', now torn and tattered.
tatteredClothTrousers: Brown colored trousers, now reduced t' much shorter trousers from distress and wear.
woodenGate: A gate crafted from lon' wooden planks with small wooden hinges. Can be opened and closed when built.
poisonIvyLeaves: Causes irritation t' th' touch; these leaves o' three do not belon' on yer person.
poisonIvySeeds: Bright green, soft seeds, used t' plant t' grow into poison ivy.
wroughtIronChest: A spacious container built from wrought iron that can store many items. Foods will spoil slower inside o' it.
ironChest: A large iron chest that be both roomy and sturdy. Foods contained within will decay at a slower rate.
switchgrassSeeds: Lon' dried grass seeds. Can be planted t' grow a longer type o' grass.
apple: A juicy, delicious red apple. Th' fruit contains seeds t' grow apple trees.
spiderEggs: Soft and squishy t' th' touch. These small silken eggs contain arachnid life inside.
tailFeathers: A fluffy clump o' white feathers, removed from an avian creature's backside.
appleSeeds: Still scented like th' apples they come from, these small brown seeds be used fer plantin' t' grow into apple trees.
venomGland: Th' venom producin' gland o' a snake, still filled with some immobilizin' venom.
ornateWoodenChest: A decorative wooden container gilded with symbols inlaid into th' wood.
rollOfRedCarpet: A rolled-up piece o' red carpet, suitable fer makin' a comfortable livin' space or welcomin' important guests.
ornateCape: A red and gold stitched cape, which drapes th' back and fastens at th' neck. Worn as a status symbol.
fireBladder: An oddly shaped organ from a fire-breathin' creature. Hot t' th' touch; it appears t' contain a deadly chemical reaction inside.
goldenKey: A large and decorative key, plated in what appears t' be gold.
woodenSword: A sturdy blunt sword, crafted from wood with a sharp piercin' point. Most useful fer sparrin' practice.
clayKiln: Similar t' a furnace, but constructed with clay and in a way that allows fer proper heat distribution fer craftin' glass and clay items.
clayCampfire: A groupin' o' clay bricks shaped into a rin' t' contain a fire.
clayFurnace: An enclosed structure made o' clay bricks, which traps in th' heat t' keep a lon'-lastin', high-temperature fire.
clayWaterStill: A carved-out clay brick with a lid. It's used t' desalinate water by boilin' it and then collectin' th' steam into a separate container.
sandstoneCampfire: A groupin' o' holystone shaped into a rin' t' contain a fire.
sandstoneFurnace: An enclosed structure made o' holystone, which traps in th' heat t' keep a lon'-lastin', high-temperature fire.
sandstoneWaterStill: A hollowed-out piece o' holystone with a lid. It's used t' desalinate water by boilin' it and then collectin' th' steam into a separate container.
stoneKiln: Similar t' a furnace, but constructed with rocks and in a way that allows fer proper heat distribution fer craftin' glass and clay items.
wroughtIronAnvil: An anvil made from wrought iron with a wooden base. Useful fer metalworkin'.
ironAnvil: A sturdy iron anvil. Used in th' production o' metal armor, weapons, tools, and more.
mageRobe: An ancient tattered robe, once owned by a spell castin' foe.
orbOfInfluence: A strange spherical orb that gives off a shimmerin' radiance on yer touch. It appears t' hum as ye hold it.
animalClaw: A sharp claw from an animal. A perfect animal by-product fer usin' as a needle.
animalPelt: Th' remains o' an unlucky skinned animal. Can be used as a makeshift garment or dismantled into th' hide and fur separately.
animalFur: A large clump o' animal fur and hair. Could be used as tinder in a situation whar wood be not available.
sharkFin: Not much more than a trophy, this carved dorsal fin remains slippery and rubbery t' th' touch.
rawReptileMeat: A grainy piece o' edible reptile flesh. Generally, not safe t' consume without bein' cooked due t' bacteria.
cookedReptileMeat: A grilled piece o' reptile meat. Th' look and texture could almost be passed as cackle.
tentacles: A slimy, wrigglin' appendage from an unlucky cephalopod. Can be eaten, but with some force due t' th' rubbery unpleasant texture.
cookedTentacles: Although, still springy t' th' touch, this cooked cephalopod appendage can be stomached much easier than if raw.
wormMeat: Essentially a mash o' worm innards, almost ground up into a paste. Definitely not th' most appetizin', but can be cooked fer better flavor.
cookedWormMeat: A cooked patty o' worm meat. Unappetizin' t' think about, but can provide as a good source o' needed nutrition.
stonePickaxe: A primitive stone pickaxe used fer minin' into rock or as a stopgap blunt weapon.
wroughtIronAxe: An axe forged out o' wrought iron, primarily used fer lumberjackin' and carvin'.
ironAxe: An iron-forged axe used in wood choppin'. Its sharp end can be used fer craftin' and carvin'.
fertileSoil: A rich and nutrient-dense soil, suitable t' grow all plants fer maximum fertility and speed.
stoneHoe: A rudimentary tillin' and gardenin' tool, used t' break up soil fer more successful growth o' plants.
wroughtIronHoe: A lon' pole with a wrought iron metal blade attached t' th' end. Used t' till th' ground fer plantin' seeds.
ironHoe: A lon'-handled gardenin' tool with a blade on th' end, forged from iron. Used t' till soil fer better plant growth.
lavaBeetleHelmet: An extremely hard and fire-resistant helmet, sourced from th' carcass o' a fallen lava beetle.
spruceSeeds: White seeds fer growin' a spruce tree, ejected from a spruce cone.
spruceNeedles: Dense, needled branches from a spruce tree. Useful fer compost or dryin' out fer tinder.
cypressCone: A rounded cone from a cypress tree, containin' seeds.
cypressSeeds: Sharp t' th' touch, these seeds can be used fer growin' cypress trees.
cypressLeaves: Flat bladed foliage from a cypress tree. Can be used fer tinder or compost when dried out.
lettuce: This leafy green vegetable be rich in vitamins and quite fillin' when eaten.
lettuceSeeds: Seeds taken from lettuce that has turned t' seed.
chiveSeeds: Th' small black appearance o' these seeds suggests they be fer growin' chives.
potato: Starchy edible tubers. Not suitable fer consumption without cookin' due t' toxicity.
potatoSeeds: An alternative way t' grow potatoes without usin' seed potatoes. These will grow into a potato plant seedlin'.
carrot: A healthy lookin' root vegetable, orange in color and full o' nutrients. Both th' taproot and leaves be edible.
carrotSeeds: Seeds fer growin' carrots, taken from seedin' carrot flowers.
cornEar: An ear o' corn, wrapped in its husk; ready t' be shucked and cooked, or eaten raw.
cornSeeds: Dried and aged corn kernels, used fer plantin' and growin' corn stalks.
cucumber: A cucumiform gourd fruit, grown from a creepin' vine. Full o' nutrients and packed with water content.
cucumberSeeds: Seeds taken from inside th' fruit o' a cucumber.
tomato: Red, plump and juicy, this savory fruit can be eaten raw fer replenishment o' hunger as well as some thirst.
tomatoSeeds: Seeds from a tomato, ready fer plantin' and germination t' grow into tomato plants.
pumpkin: A heavy orange squash, filled with edible pulp. Contains seeds fer growin' more.
pumpkinSeeds: Large, flat pumpkin seeds. Can be shelled and eaten or planted as be.
pricklyPearFruit: Th' fruitin' body o' a prickly pear cactus. Th' insides be extremely red and juicy.
sugarCaneStalks: Stout, jointed, fibrous stalks that be rich in th' sugar content. They can be quite lon' and th' insides can be chewed on fer sustenance.
sugarCaneSeeds: Seeds fer plantin' and growin' crops o' sugar cane stalks.
bushelOfWheat: Th' clipped remains o' th' stalk and grains from wheat grass.
wheat: Th' hulled spikelets from wheat grass, containin' th' raw grains.
cookedCornCob: A well cooked cob o' corn. Ready t' consume and enjoy.
bundleOfSwitchgrass: Bundled up switchgrass stalks, complete with its seeds.
cloak: An old, but sturdy hooded cloak garment. It appears t' be o' high quality from a bygone era.
woodenMortarAndPestle: Carved from wood; this makeshift device can be used fer crushin' up items.
sandstoneMortarAndPestle: A mortar and pestle carved from holystone, used t' grind up other items.
wroughtIronMortarAndPestle: Used fer pulverizin' items, forged from wrought iron.
ironMortarAndPestle: Forged from iron; this device can be used fer crushin' and grindin' other items.
rawClayMortarAndPestle: An unfired mortar and pestle, used as a grindin' device when hardened.
clayMortarAndPestle: A grindin' device made from fired and cured clay.
copperOre: Raw copper ore with a tinge o' oxidation. Can be smelted into ingot form with a cast.
copperIngot: A dense, formed brick o' copper. Slag and other impurities have been removed, makin' it useful fer forgin' into tools, weapons, and armor.
copperPickaxe: A copper pick tool, primarily used fer minin' rocks and stones; however, copper may not th' best choice fer such a tool.
copperDoubleAxe: An almost lumberin' and unwieldy copper weapon and tool.
copperShovel: A copper diggin' tool, used fer liftin' soils or resource gatherin'.
copperSpear: A lon' piercin' weapon with a copper spearhead.
copperHammer: Although copper tends t' be quite malleable, this copper hammer will do th' trick in most cases fer repair and other crafts.
copperLockpick: A small and precise device used fer pickin' locks, made with refined copper ore.
copperBuckler: A rounded copper offhanded armor piece. Copper can be an ideal material fer takin' a beatin' with such a design.
copperGauntlets: Complex and intricate, but still fairly durable. These copper hand armor pieces be used t' block damage t' yer extremities.
copperGreaves: Sturdy copper leggings that can be tied aroun' yer legs, shieldin' them from damage.
copperHelmet: A piece o' copper head armor, designed with ancient sensibilities.
copperBoots: Copper boots, work hardened and crafted t' fit closely t' yer feet size.
copperCuirass: Cold formed in a classic abdominal design, this copper cuirass can protect yer torso from damage.
copperSword: A sharp and work hardened copper blade, designed fer close quarter combat.
copperTongs: Tongs crafted from copper, used t' grasp hot objects, protectin' yer hands and fingers.
copperBullet: A nearly solid copper bullet. Used as ammunition fer slings and other ranged weaponry.
copperArrowhead: A sharp pointed arrowhead, formed from copper. Can be used as a carvin' implement.
copperChest: A roomy copper chest, used fer cachin' items and food storage, reducin' spoilage.
copperAnvil: A heavy shaped slab o' copper perched on a wooden base, used in th' production o' metal weapons, tools, and armor.
copperAxe: Th' perfect tool fer tree choppin' and gatherin'. This copper-bladed implement can also be used in carvin' and crafts that require a sharp tool.
copperHoe: A gardenin' tool used t' till ground. This tool be cold worked from copper.
copperMortarAndPestle: Used as a grindin' and crushin' tool. This mortar and pestle be sharped and work hardened from solid copper.
waterskinOfGoatMilk: A filled leather waterskin containin' th' raw milk from a goat.
clayJugOfGoatMilk: A clay jug full o' nutritious raw goat milk.
glassBottleOfGoatMilk: A bottled batch o' goat milk, filled t' th' top o' this glass bottle.
obsidian: An extremely sharp and hard shard o' obsidian, useful fer cuttin', but very brittle.
ornateBlueBook: An expensive lookin' book with a blue hard cover. Th' insides and back have heavy wear on inspection.
journal: A leather-bound soft journal. It appears it has seen a lot o' use over time.
mossCoveredBook: A book that has seen better days. It smells o' mold and earth and seems fragile.
gildedRedBook: An old, fancy lookin' book with a red cover, gilded with golden trim.
arrowShaft: A whittled down pole, used fer th' shaft o' a fletched arrow.
slitherSucker: A livin', writhin' slither sucker, constrictin' itself t' ye, causin' pain as it sinks its teeth into ye.
aberrantSlitherSucker: A livin', writhin' bilge-suckin' slither sucker, constrictin' itself t' ye, causin' pain as it sinks its teeth into ye.
strawHat: A hat made from braids o' hay, woven together. What it lacks in protection, it makes up fer in its sun-blockin' properties and style.
blackplateSabatons: Almost sharp t' th' touch, these expertly crafted annealed blackplate iron sabatons will make fer satisfactory foot protection as well as fashion.
blackplateBreastplate: A uniquely designed piece o' armor t' cover yer torso with lon' sharpened points juttin' out from th' shoulders. Made from a special annealed form o' iron.
blackplateGauntlets: Crafted from annealed iron, these blackplate gauntlets make fer excellent hand guards.
blackplateGorget: A neck guard, forged from iron and annealed, givin' it a darker appearance.
blackplateGreaves: These leggings be crafted from iron and annealed, givin' it a darkened hue and widened t' make th' wearer appear larger.
blackplateHelmet: An evil gaze has been forged into th' face o' this annealed iron helmet, givin' th' wearer a menacin' look upon equippin' it. Two sturdy metal horns pierce outwards, mimickin' some form o' animal.
deathKnightAxe: A uniquely forged axe with a gnarled design; th' signature o' a powerful death knight. Th' entire weapon be casted, makin' it very heavy, but powerful.
macuahuitl: A wooden club, adorned with razor-sharp fragments o' obsidian. Brittle in combat, but deadly and effective in practice.
obsidianArrow: A fletched arrow usin' an obsidian arrowhead, deliverin' substantial piercin' potential.
obsidianArrowhead: A brittle, but razor-sharp arrow tip, t' be crafted into an arrow with a shaft and fletchin'.
obsidianAxe: An axe with an obsidian blade, known fer its slashin' prowess, but also brittle in practice.
obsidianKnife: A shard o' obsidian fastened into a handle and bound with strin'. Can be used as a carvin' tool or in short-range combat.
obsidianShovel: A diggin' tool with a large piece o' obsidian attached t' th' end. Beautiful t' look at, but less effective due t' th' fragility o' th' obsidian.
obsidianSpear: An obsidian-tipped polearm used in melee combat or thrown fer added range.
tumbleweedSeeds: Small and slightly thorny, these seeds be used t' plant and grow tumbleweeds, as if ye ever wanted t' grow weeds.
coconutHusk: Th' fibrous outer layer o' a coconut. Useful as cordage, pulp, and tinder fer startin' fires.
peeledCoconut: Th' remainin' coconut fruit after huskin' th' outer layer. Its innards contain thirst-quenchin' coconut water and protein-rich meat. Ye may fashion this into a coconut container with strin' and cork.
coconutMeat: An opened coconut fruit, revealin' its fleshy edible coconut meat.
coconutContainerOfCoconutWater: A coconut fruit, affixed with a strin' and cork t' contain its natural juice. Th' container can be reused fer other liquids once consumed.
coconutContainer: An interim liquid container, crafted by pokin' a hole into a coconut and sealed usin' a cork.
coconutContainerOfSeawater: A coconut container filled with seawater. Not suitable fer consumin' without first bein' desalinated t' remove all th' salt content and other impurities.
coconutContainerOfDesalinatedWater: A coconut filled with water that has gone through th' desalination process.
coconutContainerOfMedicinalWater: A coconut containin' medicinal water, used fer treatin' certain conditions while also quenchin' some thirst.
coconutContainerOfPurifiedFreshWater: coconut container o' purified fresh water
Potable and purified fresh water, enclosed in a coconut container.
coconutContainerOfUnpurifiedFreshWater: coconut container o' unpurified fresh water
A container full o' unpurified fresh water, contained within a coconut. Purification be recommended before consumption.
coconutContainerOfGoatMilk: This coconut container be filled with goat milk, no doubt givin' a unique flavor when consumed.
oldEducationalScroll: An unfurled scroll with a large amount o' text explainin' some in-depth knowledge on a specific skill.
strippedLeather: Thin strips o' cut leather, useful fer makin' strings and rope.
claySandCastFlask: A moulded clay flask, used fer castin' and shapin' molten metal usin' malleable green sand.
sandstoneSandCastFlask: A mold fer castin' molten metals, made with a green sand mixture and placed into a carved piece o' holystone.
stoneSandCastFlask: A hollowed out rock with green sand mouldin' inside. Used fer castin' metal into some godforsaken shape.
animalGlue: A natural glue processed from boilin' animal bones that can be used t' reinforce and secure items.
copalResin: Ground-up hardened tree resin. Can be melted with high heat t' be used as a reinforcement and bindin' material.
boneMeal: A pestled pile o' powdered bone remnants.
pileOfDesertSand: A pile o' coarse desert sand with an orange hue. Can be refined fer use in glass makin'.
joshuaTreeLeaves: A bundle o' spiny joshua tree leaves which be almost as unique lookin' as th' joshua tree itself. Suitable fer usage as cordage or dried out and used as tinder.
joshuaTreeFruit: Th' oval-shaped fruitin' body o' th' joshua tree. It appears t' be edible but may be more pleasant cooked.
joshuaTreeFlowers: A blossomin' batch o' flowers gathered from a joshua tree. Th' flowers be sticky t' th' touch and smell quite sweet and possibly edible if not a bit bitter.
saguaroCactusFruit: A fleshy pod gathered from a saguaro cactus. It can be cut open t' discover its juicy red innards.
saguaroCactusSeeds: Oblon' black seeds extracted from th' fruit o' th' saguaro cactus.
saguaroCactusChunk: A hefty chunk o' wet, de-spined cacti. Thar does appear t' be quite a bit o' liquid contained in th' soft flesh, but it smells odd.
stoneWell: A stone-built enclosure used t' trap and collect groundwater when constructed.
sandstoneWell: A round empty enclosure made o' holystone, which can be built and extended deep into th' ground t' collect water.
clayWell: A well constructed o' clay bricks, used t' collect water by diggin' a shaft into th' ground.
aloeVeraLeaves: Thick succulent plant leaves, sharp t' th' touch and known fer their use as an antiseptic. Their inner flesh can be applied t' th' skin t' reduce burnin' pain.
aloeVeraSeeds: These thin black seeds appear t' be that from an aloe vera plant. They can be used t' grow aloe vera or eaten in dire circumstances.
deadScorpion: A dispatched scorpion, ready t' be skewered and cooked fer th' brave indifferent eater.
deadAberrantScorpion: Th' body o' a large bilge-suckin' scorpion. It can be cooked over low heat t' provide a more palatable eatin' experience.
cookedScorpion: While still a bit nauseatin' t' consume, th' cooked scorpion can provide much needed sustenance.
cookedAberrantScorpion: Even though th' bilge-suckin' scorpion be larger, and its corpse will provide much more food, th' texture will most likely be worse when consumin' it.
scorpionStinger: A dangerous item t' be held indeed. This scorpion stinger still contains its venom.
copperBakingTray: A thin rimmed bakin' sheet made from copper, primarily used fer bakin' foods.
wroughtIronBakingTray: A rigid sheet pan crafted from flattened wrought iron.
ironBakingTray: A bakin' sheet crafted from iron and used fer bakin'. It has raised edges t' help retain food and shallow liquids.
flour: Wheat ground down into a white powdery form. Used in th' process o' makin' dough.
dough: A simple kneaded dough consistin' o' wheat flour and water. Th' consistency leaves a lot t' be desired fer baked goods, but it may suffice fer some recipes.
hardtack: A nonperishable biscuit, baked at high temperatures fer lon' periods o' time t' remove all moisture from it.
hitchingPost: A sturdy wooden structure fastened with a large rope. It can be used t' hitch animals and creatures t' restrict their movement.
shreddedPaper: Torn pieces paper assembled into a loose pile. Can be turned into a mash and used as pulp or used as tinder in firemakin'.
rawMudskipper: Th' muddy corpse o' a mudskipper, ready t' clean and cook. It doesn't appear suitable t' eat without cookin'.
rawAberrantMudskipper: An enormous specimen indeed. This bilge-suckin'-sized mudskipper will make fer quite th' dish once cleaned and cooked.
cookedMudskipper: Not th' best catch fer sustenance or fer its looks. Its bulgy eyes at least have been removed fer eatin'.
cookedAberrantMudskipper: A large fishy feast brought t' ye by an atypical mudskipper.
rawRedSnapper: A massive red snapper, ready t' be cooked or dined on raw in a pinch.
cookedRedSnapper: A hefty meal fer anybody; this cooked red snapper be sure t' delight taste buds and satisfy bellies.
rawWalleye: A rather large walleye, ready t' gut and cook whole or eat raw when on th' run.
woodenShield: A sturdy wooden shield, quite effective at blockin' blunt attacks. Th' handles on th' back be fashioned out o' wood and strin'.
copperRefinementTools: A set o' delicate copper tools used fer shavin' material out o' an item, decreasin' its weight at th' cost o' durability.
wroughtIronRefinementTools: Used fer gougin' out material from items, reducin' their weight and durability. Forged and crafted from wrought iron.
ironRefinementTools: A fine set o' iron refinement tools, used fer raspin' and scrapin' out material from items t' reduce their weight, costin' their durability.
scaleBelt: A belt formed from braided cords o' dried reptile skin used t' keep yer leggings up and fer some moderate waist protection.
scaleVest: A fire-resistant vest made from sewn scales that can take a good beatin'.
scaleBoots: Scale-bound boots, sewn together usin' dried reptile skin.
scaleGloves: Skillfully crafted scale gloves, used fer hand protection when gatherin' or tendin' t' yer campfire.
cookedJoshuaTreeFlowers: A cooked batch o' joshua tree flowers. Th' cookin' process retains most o' th' nutrients but reduces some o' th' bitterness found in their uncooked form.
saguaroCactusRibs: Th' dried innards o' a fallen saguaro cactus. This gnarled and hardened woody resource be useful fer fuel or dismantlin' fer materials.
bladesOfGrass: Clippings o' grass; sharp t' th' touch when fresh, but can be dried and used fer tinder.
animalDroppings: Droppings produced by a small mammal t' be used in compostin'.
animalDung: A seemingly fresh pile o' feces, excreted from an animal. Although quite foul, it can perhaps be used fer fertilizer.
guano: Th' excrement o' a bat, t' be used as a great fertilizer due t' its high content o' nitrogen, phosphate, and potassium.
tallow: Th' rendered form o' animal fat; solid when kept cooled. A fatty and greasy substance used in cookin' or as fuel.
tallowCandle: A molded tallow candle with a strin' as a wick. A lon'-lastin' source o' illumination.
litTallowCandle: Burnin' lon' and bright, this delicious smellin' tallow candle lights yer way.
wispDust: A magical glowin' pile o' dust, extracted from a wisp. It inexplicably feels weightless, yet burdensome in yer hands.
magicalAspect: A magical compound that be warm t' th' touch and ready t' apply on t' items, enchantin' them with new characteristics.
goldenSextant: A metallic brass-coated navigational tool. Used fer measurin' th' horizon and sun t' judge distances.
rawChoppedFish: A roughly chopped assortment o' fish meat and viscera t' be used as bait or cooked fer consumption in several manners.
cookedChoppedFish: A sizable helpin' o' chopped fish cooked and ready t' ingest.
cookedFishKebab: A skewered mass o' fish chunks cooked delicately over flame t' be consumed off th' spear fer an added flare.
ashCement: A tacky slurry o' cement, created by grindin' ash and mixin' it with liquid, heated t' a glowin' temperature, then broken down again with water.
ashCementBrick: Th' final form o' th' ash cement; mixed with th' once-heated mixture and clay t' give it rigidity, then baked over fire.
ashCementFlooring: Floorin' made from interweavin' ash cement bricks.
ashCementWall: A wall constructed o' recycled ash cement. Although th' resource be abundant, th' durability be not.
iceShard: A smartly meltin' jagged shard o' ice. Can be melted down t' liquid form usin' a container.
penguinEgg: A rather large egg laid by a penguin. Th' shape differs slightly from a cackle's fruit and feels much denser.
boiledPenguinEgg: Th' whites o' this egg be translucent, and th' yolk be unset and bright orange. Although much different than a cackle fruit, it will be just as packed with protein and nutrition.
rawPenguinMeat: A carved portion o' penguin meat. Th' meat be very oily and comes off as a cross between fish, cackle, and mammalian meat.
cookedPenguinMeat: Although slightly off-puttin', this greasy cooked meat will provide ample sustenance.
crowberries: Purplish-black berries taken from th' small shrubbery o' a crowberry plant. They be acidic, bitter and possibly toxic, but could be more palatable cooked.
cookedCrowberries: A stewed batch o' crowberries, emphasizin' their natural sugars while removin' their bitter tannins.
crowberrySeeds: Tiny red-brown seeds taken from a batch o' crowberry drupes.
winterberries: A twn' o' bright red winterberries. They look like th' type o' berry that would be consumed by birds, but may be harmful t' humans.
winterberrySeeds: A handful o' seeds, presumably used t' plant and grow more winterberries, a holly plant that can grow in colder climates.
arcticPoppies: A bundle o' bright yellow poppies o' th' arctic variety which can be used medicinally.
arcticPoppySeeds: A large collection o' small poppy seeds.
pirateHat: A cocked hat, typically worn by seafarin' people and more notably, pirate folk known fer their distinctive tricorne style.
aloeVeraBandage: A dual purpose bandage type. Used t' treat bleedin' as well as th' effects o' bein' burned.
sharkTooth: A large tooth from a shark, serrated alon' its edges and sharp th' touch. Could be used as a rudimentary cuttin' tool.
copperKnife: A flattened and sharpened copper blade, affixed t' a smooth handle, carved and fitted fer each finger and thumb.
wroughtIronKnife: A pointed knife crafted from wrought iron; ideal in usage fer carvin' and craftin'.
ironKnife: A razor-sharp iron edge bound t' a delicately polished handle. Can be used in many situations includin' combat, harvestin', carvin', and more.
tinOre: A small fragment o' tin ore, mixed with other elemental impurities.
tinIngot: A refined block o' tin, ready t' be cast or shaped into soft, metal implements.
tinPickaxe: A pickaxe made from a pole and tin head. Th' softness o' tin leaves a lot t' be desired fer such a tool.
tinDoubleAxe: A double-ended tin axe; more decorative than combat-ready due t' th' softness o' th' metal o' choice.
tinShovel: A shovel that would likely deform easily when used in practice due t' th' use o' tin as th' metal o' choice in this craft.
tinSpear: A spear with a point crafted from tin. Upon some godforsaken impact, ye expect this t' blunten instantly.
tinHammer: A tin-forged hammer, used fer many crafts or repairin' items.
tinLockpick: A soft metal lockpickin' tool with seemingly very fragile prongs. A delicate touch may be required.
tinShield: A uniquely designed tin shield, seemingly forged from a large slab o' tin. Th' design might be th' only thin' goin' fer it due t' th' deformation properties o' tin.
tinGloves: Delicately crafted tin-forged gloves, used fer style and moderate protection. Mostly fer style.
tinChausses: A pair o' tin leggings t' be used as inferior protection or as decoration.
tinBevor: A protective coverin' fer one's neck and chin; crafted from tin.
tinHelmet: A uniquely styled helmet made from tin. It becomes low in durability when used fer its practical purpose.
tinFootgear: A pair o' tin-crafted shoes. They be lightweight, but probably not th' most durable.
tinSword: A smartly deformin' and bluntenin' tin sword, ready t' be used in combat. "Ready" may be a stretch.
tinTongs: One would think these tongs might be more decorative than practical given that th' meltin' temperature o' tin be so low.
tinArrow: A fletched arrow with a tin arrowhead affixed t' th' shaft. Ready t' strike a creature from afar. Th' arrowhead will deform on impact.
tinBullet: A soft and lightweight ball o' tin t' be used in slings.
tinArrowhead: Although this likely won't make a great arrow in th' end, it might get th' job done if blunt and piercin' damage be what ye be after.
tinChest: A tin chest crafted with an exaggerated boxy design. Suitable fer holdin' all types o' materials and items.
tinAnvil: A large formed metal surface, propped up on some wood. One might think a better idea would be t' reverse that order due t' th' softness o' tin.
tinAxe: A tin axe with a curved edge, used fer wood choppin'. Not likely t' be effective fer lon' or at all in this task due t' th' softness o' tin.
tinHoe: A tin hoe, t' be used fer tillin' th' ground t' plant seeds. Th' tool's head will likely deteriorate smartly.
tinMortarAndPestle: Used fer mixin' and grindin' materials, this tin device feels much lighter than it looks.
tinBakingTray: This large sheet o' molded tin can be used t' cook food, although some care may be required t' make sure it doesn't melt in application.
tinRefinementTools: Delicate tin-based tools, used t' refine and reduce th' weight o' other crafted items.
tinKnife: A tin forged knife with a fine edge and quality handle. Its edge will smartly blunten in use.
bronzeIngot: A pristine brick o' molded bronze alloy t' be melted down and cast into other forms.
bronzePickaxe: A bronze-cast tool fer use in minin' and breakin' through rock-based terrain.
bronzeDoubleAxe: A two-sided axe forged in bronze and affixed t' a pole with strin'. Used primarily fer combat.
bronzeShovel: A diggin' tool with a bronze shovel head with many applications such as choppin', minin', diggin', and more.
bronzeSpear: Th' spearhead cast from bronze adorns th' end o' a lon', widdled, and smooth pole; together formin' this well-crafted spear.
bronzeHammer: A bronzen mallet tool, used fer repairin' and craftin' other items, especially those made from metal.
bronzeLockpick: A fine and superior bronze lockpickin' contraption. Although it appears complex, it be bound t' work wonders on stubborn locks.
bronzeKiteShield: A shield formed into a kite shape allowin' protection alon' a full body length. A unique pattern be riveted t' its center.
bronzeGauntlets: Bronze-forged hand protective armor. These gauntlets feature unique barbed bracer designs workin' their way up yer forearms.
bronzeGreaves: A pair o' bronze greaves, used t' wrap and fit against yer legs fer more than adequate protection.
bronzeBevor: A piece o' protective bronze armor fer th' chin and neck area.
bronzeHelmet: A helmet fit fer royalty, at least from th' looks alone. This stylishly crafted headgear be great fer takin' a beatin' as well as lookin' illustrious.
bronzeBoots: Many delicately crafted bronze pieces be hinged together t' form these protective boots.
bronzeChestArmor: A bronze armor chest piece with a unique, stylish design with split tassets fer additional waist and upper thigh protection.
bronzeSword: Masterly crafted, this bronze sword sparkles with an astonishin' luster, seemingly almost capable o' blindin' yer foes with its sheen alone.
bronzeTongs: Cast bronze metal tongs, used fer blacksmithin' endeavors and liftin' hot objects out o' fires.
bronzeArrow: Straight and true this arrow looks t' be, decorated with a sharp bronze arrowhead.
bronzeBullet: A spherical ball o' alloyed metal t' be used as ammunition in slings and other devices.
bronzeArrowhead: One touch t' th' tip o' this would lead t' certain bloodshed. This bronze arrowhead be ready t' affix t' a wooden shaft and fletchin' t' create an arrow.
bronzeChest: Yer best bet fer large storage capacity. This masterly crafted bronze chest be suitable fer storin' a plethora o' items.
bronzeAnvil: A shaped wedge o' alloyed bronze conducive t' hammerin' metal objects on fer th' procurement o' weapons, tools, or armor.
bronzeAxe: A bronzen axe, used fer carvin', gatherin', and general lumberjackin' functions.
bronzeHoe: A fine bronzen gardenin' tool, used t' form lined pathways in th' dirt fer plantin' seeds.
bronzeMortarAndPestle: Usin' a bronze alloy, this set o' tools can be used t' crush and grind materials used in other crafts.
bronzeBakingTray: Excessive be one word used t' describe this piece o' cookware made from forged bronze.
bronzeRefinementTools: A set o' small bronze tools used fer filin', shapin', and general refinement o' other items, reducin' their weight in th' process.
bronzeKnife: An expertly crafted carvin' tool and an instrument o' death if used in close quarters against an unwittin' foe.
iceBrick: A solid block o' ice, chipped and carved away from a glacier or ice wall.
snowBrick: A compressed block o' snow. Dense and rigid enough t' perhaps build a wall or floorin' fer a makeshift snow hut.
iceWall: Constructed from large ice bricks, this towerin' cold barrier can be built t' protect against th' elements, although, t' a limited degree due t' its temperature.
iceFlooring: A slippery interwoven mass o' ice blocks. Less than practical one may argue.
snowWall: An erected wall o' compressed bricks o' snow t' be used t' build a snow hut.
snowFlooring: A flattened and packed tile o' snow, presumably used fer walkin' on inside a snow or ice hut.
caliginousScrap: This piece o' material fell from th' dark foe. It appears t' be vanishin' as ye hold it.
magicalExtract: A heap o' what could only be described as "darkness". Cold t' th' touch and unsettlin'. Yer mind races as a general unease washes over ye.
shimmeringFibers: A few strands o' fiber o' an unknown origin that appear t' catch th' light at just th' right way and dance light across yer hands.
magicalTwine: A seemingly unbreakable piece o' twine; glowin' as ye hold it. Can be used t' enhance other items.
sandstoneHammer: A hammer carved out o' holystone. It appears very brittle and will not survive many uses.
sandstoneBullet: A bullet fer use with slings t' take a shot at some hapless creature. It be likely t' break smartly due t' th' use o' holystone in its creation.
sandstoneAnvil: An anvil crafted from holystone, possibly not th' best material fer such a task due t' its brittle form.
snowScarecrow: A representation o' a human figure created with piles o' snow and adorned with unique items fer its limbs and facial features.
frozenFlesh: A piece o' what appears t' be rotten flesh, luckily frozen t' be disposed o' before thawin' out.
animalTusk: A lumberin' curved tusk from a large mammal. Can be used as a primitive weapon or carved and broken down into other forms.
whitePineCone: A sap-covered pine cone, dropped or gathered from a white pine tree. It appears t' still contain th' seeds within.
whitePineSeeds: Seeds harvested from a white pine cone fer plantin' or eatin'.
whitePineNeedles: Distinctively lon' pine needles from a white pine tree, emittin' a pleasant aroma as ye hold them.
furCoat: A balmy chest garment crafted from th' furry hide o' an animal.
furMittens: A pair o' fur mittens with one compartment fer yer fingers, and another one fer yer thumb fer increased warmth.
furBoots: A set o' boots designed fer colder climates, made from animal pelts with extra fur added fer protection and comfort.
birdDroppings: Droppings produced by some type o' winged creature. Can be used as an ingredient in compost.
hardenedCoil: An extremely heavy metallic coil with a sprin'-like frame that resonates an odd noise as it moves aroun' in yer pack.
magicalBinding: A sturdy magical bindin' that appears t' be suitable t' attach t' equipment in some form.
armoredScales: Hardened, keratin-based scales useful fer craftin' protective armor.
rawPangolinMeat: An edible cut o' meat butchered from an unlucky pangolin. Likely not suitable t' eat uncooked.
cookedPangolinMeat: A well-done piece o' cooked pangolin meat, hopefully free from some godforsaken parasites or viruses.
armoredScaleBelt: Together with strin' and armored scales, this garment be meant t' hold up some godforsaken leggings or pants while providin' defense t' yer waist section.
armoredScaleVest: Armor crafted with alternatin' small and large keratin scales arranged in th' shape o' a vest.
armoredScaleBoots: Finely crafted boots, made from armored scales and tightly wrapped and sewn together in th' form o' footwear.
armoredScaleCrown: An arrangement o' armored scales shaped into a headband appearin' like a crown when worn.
armoredScaleBevor: A rather uncomplicated piece o' neck protectin' armor made from armored scales.
armoredScaleGloves: A pair o' gloves crafted with armored scales. Not th' most comfortable, but appears t' be quite protective on one's hands.
tinNeedle: A needle molded from tin and not likely t' hold a point fer lon'.
copperNeedle: A pointed copper needle used fer sewin' and stitchin', both fabrics and flesh on occasion.
wroughtIronNeedle: A useful implement fer stitchin' together items with cordage or strin'.
ironNeedle: A stron' and rather broad iron needle. Hopefully, this ends up bein' used on fabrics more than fer sutures.
bronzeNeedle: A needle with a fine point, crafted from bronze and primed fer sewin'.
tuftsOfTanglehead: Tufts o' tanglehead grass; prickly and clingy t' th' touch. They seem t' stick and tangle t' each other as ye hold them.
tangleheadSeeds: Seeds fer growin' tanglehead grass, known fer its tendency t' tangle together due t' their paired spikelet heads and small clingy fibers.
wispInAGlassBottle: A confined wisp, visible through th' glass in its compressed form. Its blue light dances aroun' as ye hold it.
aberrantWispInAGlassBottle: bilge-suckin' wisp in a glass bottle
An bilge-suckin' wisp trapped in a glass bottle. It violently shakes and moves aroun' as ye grasp th' bottle.
wispInAClayJug: A clay jug with a trapped wisp contained within. It emits a strange sound as it rumbles aroun' in yer pack.
aberrantWispInAClayJug: bilge-suckin' wisp in a clay jug
A clay jug filled t' th' brim with an odd, malicious creature known as a wisp. Ye can attempt t' pour it out if ye be so darin'.
aberrantWispInACoconutContainer: bilge-suckin' wisp in a coconut container
An angry firey gaseous entity trapped within th' confines o' a coconut container.
wispInAWaterskin: A waterskin containin' a very special creature.
aberrantWispInAWaterskin: An imprisoned bilge-suckin' wisp, held within an ordinary waterskin. It likely will not be happy after bein' released.
strawScarecrow: A decoy meant t' appear as a manacin' tall humanoid, perhaps strikin' fear into lesser creatures and animals.
cactusScarecrow: A stack o' cacti, carved and stood as if it were a human. Just much greener and much more spikey.
clothShirt: A simple white short-sleeved shirt, perfect fer a sunny day, and not so much otherwise.
clothTrousers: A fine, if not plain lookin' pair o' brown trousers, suitable fer coverin' yer lower regions a bit.
unripePapaya: An unripened green and hardened papaya fruit. Likely not suitable t' eat yet.
papaya: A ripened papaya, firm t' th' touch, with some give t' it. Ready t' be cut open and eaten.
papayaSeeds: A gelatinous handful o' slimey papaya seeds. They don't seem very appetizin', but may be safe t' consume.
palapalaiFrond: Th' leaves from a palapalai fern, slightly prickly t' a touch with small bristlelike hairs that cover th' leaves.
palapalaiSpores: Harvested spores; contained in small casings, taken from th' underside o' fern fronds fer growin' palapalai.
buttonMushroomSpores: Th' spore print from a button mushroom. Th' spores can be placed into soil fer attemptin' t' grow into mycelium, then into mushrooms.
flyAmanitaSpores: Spores removed from th' fly amanita fer attemptin' t' grow more o' them.
brambleCrown: A twisted circular floral arrangement meant t' wear as royalty wears a crown.
darkBrambleCrown: A blackened, unnaturally dark arrangement o' twigs, leaves, and other brush. Uncomfortably, t' be worn as a crown.
cotton: This downy fiber be an ideal material fer spinnin' thread and makin' fabrics.

joinServerRetryReason.unableToConnectToDedicatedMatchmakingSer:

WebRTC timed out.
This could be caused by various networkin' issues. Th' server owner could try forwardin' port 38740 t' solve this issue.

View th' {(https://www.waywardgame.com/multiplayer): multiplayer page} fer more information.

If it does not recover, please save and abort th' game.

multiplayerConnecting: Waitin' fer th' server t' respond...

stokeValue: Incredibly combustible and strangely already hot t' th' touch.

crafter: All items be crafted with extra durability, at th' cost o' increased craftin' difficulty.
gatherer: Start with lumberjackin' and minin' skill. These skills gain at a slower rate.
locksmith: Start with lockpickin' skill. Successful lockpickin' has a higher chance o' attractin' hostile creatures.
reaperOfSouls: Killed 50 pirate dredgies and harvested their corpses.
Pirate dredgies will continuously spawn in locations not normally accessible.
thrower: Thrown items deal extra damage. Throwin' skill be gained at a slower rate.
trapper: Traps deal extra damage. Trappin' skill gains at a slower rate.
treasureHunter: Dug or fished up 10 treasure chests.
collector: Start with a completely random item. Default startin' items be disabled.
explorer: Stepped on or gathered from every type o' tile.
grandmaster: Begin with two additional startin' skills. Skills be gained at a slower rate.
prepared: Equipped somethin' in each equipment slot.
Start with an extra piece o' equipment.
doctor: Start with an extra healin' item.
seafarer: Sailed t' civilization and completed th' game.
navigator: Traveled th' seas in search o' new islands.
Start with a raft, at th' cost o' startin' hungrier and thirstier.
dragonSlayer: Bilge-suckin' drakes ne'er spawn. Drakes breathe fire more often.
treasurer: Collected every one o' th' six types o' booty.
Start with a remarkable piece o' equipment. Start with 32,000 malignity.
pulchritudinous: Equipped a magical item in each equipment slot.
Start with a magical piece o' equipment.
malevolent: Start with 8000 malignity. Benignity be gained at 2x speed.
benevolent: Start with 8000 benignity. Malignity be gained at 2x speed.
boundless: Begin with three additional startin' skills. Skills be gained at a slower rate.
talented: Reached 1000% in skill percentages across all skills.
Begin with an additional startin' skill. Skills be gained at a slower rate.
pacifier: Tamed one o' each tamable creature.
Start with a tamed bilge-suckin' creature.
merchant: Merchants give slightly better deals, but start with less items in their duffle.
notekeeper: Jotted down a note fer each situation.
Start with a book, paper, and an inkstick.
huntsman: All creatures have a small chance o' startin' "scared"
challenger: Start with a piece o' booty.
destroyerOfMagi: Killed 50 wisps and harvested their corpses.
Wisps regularly will continuously spawn in locations not normally accessible.
helmsman: Discovered each different island type while travelin'.
Start with a bullboat, at th' cost o' startin' hungrier and thirstier.
multitasker: Use each skill at least once.
All skills be buffed by 10% at th' start. Skills be gained at a slower rate.
apocryphal: Collected items with one o' every magical property.
Start with an item with up t' three magical properties on it.
diverse: Played a game in every game mode.
All startin' stats reduced heavily. Ye received two stats points fer every gain.
traitor: Creatures gain double th' maximum health on re-tame, but un-tame twice as fast.
masterOfAll: Start with one skill at 100%. It cannot be raised past 100% through bonuses.

dynamic: Tracks be chosen based on situation.

backToCivilization:
Havin' found all th' treasures, th' force that prevented me return back from once I came had finally been lifted. I returned with th' treasures in me sailboat, retracin' me coordinates from th' island t' th' village I once called me home. I'm not sure if it be "home" anymore.

Fortunately, th' booty that I had returned with has made me very wealthy indeed.

Even so, somethin' calls me back. Though me time on th' island was survival; I survived. I thrived in fact. There's a yearnin' fer excitement. There's a cravin' fer more booty. T' exploit th' island o' its bounty at th' expense o' its anger.

Is this part o' th' mystery and why nobody has heard o' these places? All who that has heard o' them ne'er leave, and even those that do, always even up returnin'. I must go back. It be no longer an option.

Nobody ever truly leaves th' island.
bleeding: {0?{0}:Usin' me bare hands t' {1}} has caused me t' begin bleedin'. If I do not cease th' flow o' blood, me situation will smartly become much grimmer. I must stem th' flow o' blood usin' a bandage, tourniquet, or suture. I'm startin' t' feel a bit faint…
burned: Me seared flesh remains as painful as th' moment I burned it. I know that while I am in this constant and unabatin' pain, me focus and wellbein' will be hampered. It may be wise t' attempt t' soothe this pain. Perhaps with pourin' liquid over th' burn, I can stifle th' agony. It may be an even wiser idea t' take a swim and use th' minerals within th' water t' both sooth and heal th' afflicted wound.
caving:
When outside, I hear th' chirps and calls o' birds and small animals, and I hear th' stron' winds from th' ocean rustle th' leaves o' trees and other fauna. Every once in a while, in th' distance, I hear a loud growl or th' sounds o' a fevered chase through th' underbrush, o' a predator and its prey.

Down here, however, be different story. It be eerily quiet in th' briny depths o' th' island. And unlike above, th' infrequent sounds that I {/do/} hear send shivers down me spine. A faint tip, tap, as water drips in th' distance, a thin whistle as air passes through cracks in th' rough stone. An intermittent clickin' noise, o' what I can only imagine must be th' claws o' a large arthropod.

It would be surprisin' if these caves didn't have {/somethin'/} within them. Thar be other signs o' human activity on this island, th' caves should be no different. Maybe booty or other swag. However, I would be lyin' t' myself if I said I wasn't horrified at th' thought o' continuin' deeper.
combat:
As I engage in combat with {0}, I acknowledge it may not be th' best course o' actions, given me current situation. Th' concept o' {/"fight or flight"/} remains lingerin' in me mind. Perhaps runnin' from {0} could be a consideration in th' future. Attemptin' t' tame or offer food t' th' creature has also crossed me mind.

If all else fails, I must protect me life through mortal conflict and dispatch o' th' creature. I will endeavor t' record me findings on th' effectiveness o' me weapons against certain types o' creatures. I note fer example, that {0} be seemingly resistant t' {1?{1}:no} damage types, and vulnerable t' {2?{2}:no} damage types. This also applies t' th' potential damage th' creature inflicts on me against me own armor.

In a previous situation, parryin' proved t' be very valuable, allowin' me t' block incomin' attacks from me sparrin' partner. As lon' as I hold two weapons or a shield in me off-hand, I should be able t' mitigate some damage from me opponent.
corpse: {0} {1?lay:lays} thar, lifeless. In order t' maintain me own life, perhaps it would be beneficial t' use a sharp tool or material t' butcher {1?these:this} {1?corpses:corpse} and gather th' usable remains.
creatureTaming:
I recall a more innocent time in me life as I witness th' deceased {0}. Th' adage, {/"violence be not th' answer"/} floods me mind as I ponder practicin' benevolence against th' creatures here.

I could attempt t' tame creatures usin' me skills; however, perhaps an even better idea would be t' offer th' creature food it would like t' consume. Both options involve gettin' close t' th' creature. Perhaps I can simply leave th' items on th' ground and see if they will act in kindness towards me after acceptin' me offerin' as they move towards it. I know I will become more successful with any o' these options as me skills grow.
dehydration:
Th' rhyme echoes in me head, {/"water, water, everywhere, nor some godforsaken drop t' drink"/}. Me mind runs cloudy; me mouth bone-dry. I'll require water if I am t' last any longer.

Unfortunately, th' largest body o' water in me vision be nearly undrinkable in its natural form. I'll need t' construct a water still if I am t' convert th' salinated sea water t' potable water. It be quite th' endeavor indeed.

If I am lucky, I may be able t' come across fresh water sources inland or in th' caves below. It should be drinkable in its natural form, but errin' on th' side o' caution, it may be prudent t' boil it fer safety.
durability:
Me {0} be close t' breakin' from use. {1?Usin' me {1}, I should be able t' repair it easily enough:With th' right resources, I should be able t' fashion myself a hammer t' repair it}.

If I actively search out high quality materials t' craft me tools, armor, and weapons with, I can expect much higher durability on them, especially after me skills have improved. {2?I can also craft glue to:If I ever manage t' come across out how t' concoct a glue, I can} further reinforce me items, providin' much higher durability.
encumbered:
This confounded burden! Me pack be overflowin' with heavy items that I will need t' purge in order t' decrease me encumbrance. Carryin' this many items will slow down me movement and heavily impact me stamina.

Some o' th' heaviest things in me duffle include {0}, {1}, and {2}.
failureInCrafting:
I failed in me attempt t' craft {0}, mostly due t' me lack o' skill and knowledge in {1}. I think with repeated attempts, I'll gain some knowledge t' hopefully succeed in craftin' {0} eventually. I also hope that th' materials can suffer th' wear that me poor craftin' skills be placin' on them. I may even need t' replace some components that I am damagin' on each attempt.

Although I have many ideas on what t' craft with th' items in me duffle, some o' them may be quite difficult t' craft without first havin' an intermediate, advanced or even expert skill level in th' craft fer each item.
gardening:
As I work on {0}, I reflect on th' growth stages o' vegetation that I have witnessed. Most plants seem t' begin producin' th' most valuable resources at aroun' th' flowerin' stage, but I have observed th' most bountiful haul comes durin' th' ripenin' stage, when th' fruits and vegetables be ripe fer th' takin' and th' seeds be available t' harvest.

If I want t' succeed at gardenin', I may also need t' consider tryin' me hand at craftin' fertilizer and fertile soil fer me garden. Th' quality o' terrain in which I plant th' seed or mushroom will likely impact its growth as well. I mustn't also forget t' water me plants. Waterin' them will surely help them grow and survive lon' enough t' produce th' resources which seem all too dire in me situation.
healthIssues:
Me wellbein' be at an all-time low. I'm bruised, battered, and nearly defeated. Me only chance at a respite be through medical intervention, rest, healthy foods, or ideally, all three.

{0?As much as it pains me t' consider it, disassemblin' me clothin' t' craft makeshift bandages appears t' be a good option in me current predicament.}{1?Luckily, I do have some items t' be used fer healin' within me duffle includin' {1}.}
inedible: Consumin' {0} may not have been th' best o' ideas. I {1?think I may:am probably lucky not to} have been poisoned by it... It would be prudent t' pay better attention t' what I ingest. Somethin' like that should only be consumed when I am in dire straits.
itemQualities: As I loot {0}, I notice it be {Misc:ColorizeQuality:({1},{ARTICLE:{2} specimen})} indeed. I'm sure usin' this in a craft will benefit th' end result greatly. I also observe it appears t' have greater durability and strength than most other items in its class, resultin' in much greater endurance when used.
mercantile:
I meet {0} today, a person in a similar state as myself; survivin' on this island and livin' off th' land. They seemed friendly enough and offered t' trade items they had found with me.

Me skill in barterin' may pay off when decidin' on a trade value, which we have signified with a credit system. {0} gives me credit when I give items t' them, and reversely, removes credits when I come across an item in their duffle worth takin' fer myself.

Even though I found this valuable tradin' partner, th' thought o' somethin' more nefarious has crossed me mind. Takin' their supply by force would likely put me at odds with th' island, but it may be worth it fer their belongings and equipment.
nightfall: Dusk be smartly approachin'. Who could know what creatures lurk in th' darkness — it would be wise t' seek shelter or make a camp fer th' night.
poisoned: Me vision blurs as I write this; me stomach tied in knots. {0} has caused me t' become poisoned. I can feel myself gettin' weaker even through th' process o' writin' this note. Thirst consumes me, and me wellbein' be in jeopardy. I must attempt t' fabricate a cure. Perhaps plants o' a medicinal nature may aid me in this bodily turmoil.
reputation:
It seems that as time passes and th' struggle fer survival continues, th' actions I take which be averse t' th' benefit o' th' island come back t' haunt me.

When I sow plants, or respect th' island's inhabitants, less o' them seem t' be hostile. Likewise, when I gather resources, deface th' landscape, or attack creatures, I see malicious beasts much more frequently.

As o' writin' this, it seems as though th' island be {0?{#--COLOR-GOOD:benign}:{#--COLOR-BAD:malign}}. Fer th' benefit o' me survival, I may want t' limit th' scope o' me damage t' th' natural environment.
seaTravel:
I finally made it!

{0?Me {0} chopped through th' rough seas on me journey t' this new set o' islands.:All o' th' time I have practiced swimmin' has allowed me t' travel t' an entirely new set o' islands.} {1>0?{2=0?Usin' {1...}, I was able t' significantly speed up me journey, reducin' th' food and water needed fer th' voyage.:Usin' {1...}, I was able t' save some time on me journey, but it would have been even faster with {2...}, reducin' th' food and water required even further.}:If I had {2...}, I could have significantly reduced th' time needed fer th' voyage, savin' much food and water fer th' trip. It was difficult navigatin' th' seas without them.}
staminaReplenishment: Me breath be fast and heavy. I'm nearly worked t' th' point o' exhaustion. I should proceed t' slow me work t' a bare minimum while me stamina replenishes itself. More efficiently, I could try restin' on th' ground, or even sleep in a bedroll fer maximum benefits. Rest be important fer me sanity and me survival.
starvation:
I'm wastin' away. Each step I take feels like a step closer t' death, and each one o' those steps makes me weaker and weaker.

I would eat anythin' in this state. Yes, even all th' undesirables I have passed on throughout me life. I'll take th' vile organs from a rat, I'll take th' bitter seeds from a tree, and I'll even eat some godforsaken creepy crawlies I discover. Anythin' fer a little sustenance on this blasted island.

It might be a good idea t' search further out or even think about plantin' me own crops. I don't know how lon' I'll be here fer. If me hunger be anythin' t' go by, it might not be fer much longer.
stranded:
I awake t' find myself no longer in th' company o' hearties or a fine seafarin' vessel. Instead I discover myself in tattered clothin', with but a few possessions: {0}, and other shoddy items.

Booty... Th' thought be vague and fleetin', but... I remember somethin' about booty.
toolUse:
I'm reminded o' th' proverb, {/"the right tool fer th' right job"/} as I attempt t' {0} usin' me bare hands. I know that usin' a tool fer {1} would reduce me change o' injury as well as provide much needed efficiency.

Furthermore, I've observed th' increased efficiency o' usin' a bladed tool while lumberjackin' and usin' a blunt tool while minin'. Th' proverb proves its innate truth.
treasureHunting:
I have happened upon a tattered map and on closer inspection o' th' drawings, appears t' be a marked location. It may take some time t' come across th' location based on me surroundings, but I believe I should investigate this further. As me skill in cartography improves, I'm sure I will be able t' make more o' th' drawings out. This could very well be a treasure map.

Although me memory be fleetin', I do recall me penchant fer booty.

chemistry:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' chemical mixtures.
 - Increases effectiveness o' consumin' chemical compounds.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' chemical mixtures.
anatomy:
- Increases accuracy o' creature health, resistance, and vulnerability descriptions.
 - Decreases chance o' bleedin', poisonin', and burnin' pain from creatures.
 - Increases accuracy o' status effect tooltip descriptions.
 - Increases effectiveness o' healin' consumables.
 - Increases success chance when healin'.
 - Decreases chance o' bleedin' when usin' bare hands durin' combat or gatherin'.
 - Increases th' amount o' resources butchered at a time.
 - Increases effectiveness o' eatin' raw meat.
marksmanship: - Increases attack damage, accuracy, and maximum range when usin' bows and firearms.
blacksmithing:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' metal.
 - Increased chance o' successfully repairin', reinforcin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', alterin', and refinin' metal items.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' metal.
botany:
- Decreases chance o' tramplin' plants when steppin' on them.
 - Increases chance o' gatherin'/harvestin' resources on plants.
 - Increases th' quality o' resources gathered/harvested from trees and plants.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while gatherin'/harvestin' from plants.
 - Decreases chance o' damagin' th' plant when harvestin' or gatherin' from it.
 - Decreases seed germination time.
 - Increases th' amount o' resources gathered/harvested at a time.
 - Increases effectiveness o' eatin' plant-based consumables.
 - Increased chance o' successfully preservin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', and refinin' plant-based items.
camping:
- Increases th' amount o' turns slept when usin' a bedroll.
 - Increases chance o' startin' a fire.
 - Increases th' accuracy o' tellin' th' time with a sundial.
 - Increases th' effectiveness o' extinguishin' open fires with th' smother action.
 - Increases chance t' successfully add fuel t' a torch.
cartography:
- Increases th' range in which ye can dn' or cast t' gather booty from.

cooking:

fishing:

 - Increases chance o' gatherin'/harvested resources on mushrooms.
 - Increases th' quality o' resources gathered/harvested from mushrooms.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while gatherin'/harvestin' from mushrooms.
 - Decreases chance o' damagin' th' mushrooms when harvestin' or gatherin' from it.
 - Decreases spore germination time.
 - Increases th' amount o' resources gathered/harvested at a time.
 - Increases effectiveness o' eatin' mushroom consumables.
 - Increased chance o' successfully preservin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', and refinin' mushrooms.
parrying:
- Increases yer base defense value when holdin' an item in each hand.
 - Increases chance t' take less damage in combat.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction from bein' attacked.
stonecrafting:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' stones and rocks.
 - Increased chance o' successfully repairin', reinforcin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', alterin', and refinin' stone items.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' stones and rocks.
swimming:
- Increases speed in water travel.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction in water.
 - At high skill, allows combatin' th' tides t' travel t' other islands.
tactics:
- Increases yer base attack value.
 - Increases chance t' hit targets in combat.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while attackin'.
 - Increases damage when usin' throwin' or marksmanship.
tailoring:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' cloth or fabric.
 - Increased chance o' successfully repairin', reinforcin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', alterin', and refinin' fabric items.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' cloth or fabric.
throwing: - Increases attack damage, accuracy, and maximum range when throwin' or slingin' an item.
tinkering:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' miscellaneous resources and methods.
 - Increased chance o' successfully repairin', reinforcin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', alterin', and refinin' miscellaneous items.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' miscellaneous resources.
trapping:
- Increases th' amount o' damage and success rate o' trappin' creatures.
 - Reduces chance o' settin' off traps and reduces damage taken from traps.
woodworking:
- Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items usin' wood.
 - Increased chance o' successfully repairin', reinforcin', transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', alterin', and refinin' wooden items.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items usin' wood.
taming:
- Increases chance o' successfully tamin' a creature.
 - Increases length o' time creature will be tamed fer.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction when tamin'/offerin'/milkin'/hitchin'/pettin'.
 - Decreases amount o' happiness reduced when milkin' goats.
 - Increases chance o' tamin' when offerin' a bilge-suckin' creature items.
 - Increased chance o' hitchin' bilge-suckin' or untamed creatures.
 - Increases effectiveness o' pettin' creatures t' increase happiness and other bonus effects.
gardening:
- Increases chance o' plantin' a plant or mushroom.
 - Decreases growth time when waterin' plants or mushrooms.
 - Increases chance o' successfully tillin'.
 - Decreases chance o' stamina reduction while tillin'.
 - Influences quality and success rate o' craftin' items requirin' gardenin' skill.
 - Increased chance o' successfully transmogrifyin', enchantin', upgradin', and refinin' items requirin' gardenin' skill.
 - Adds ability t' detect craftin' efficacy with increasin' accuracy when craftin' items requirin' gardenin' skill.
bartering: - Influences th' amount o' barter credit received when tradin' items.
seafaring:
- Allows travelin' t' further islands in a single trip.
 - Reduces th' stamina cost o' encumbrance while paddlin'.
 - Reduces th' time it takes t' travel between islands, tharby reducin' th' hunger and thirst gained on th' voyage, th' damage dealt t' th' boat, and th' amount that items decay.

defense: Th' ways in which ye be, or be not, protected from creatures and th' elements.

bleeding: Yer wounds be leakin' like a seive.
{0?- {0}% chance t' pass each damage tick.}
- Reduces hunger timer every damage tick.
poisoned: Ye feel nauseous as ye writhe in pain.
{0?- {0}% chance t' pass each damage tick.}
- Reduces thirst timer every damage tick.
burned: Yer skin be raw and inflamed.
{0?- {0}% chance t' pass each damage tick.}
encumbered: Ye be carryin' too much weight.
starving: Ye feel empty and lethargic as yer body begins t' consume itself.
dehydrated: Yer throat be parched, yer mouth be dry, and yer head aches.
overheating: Th' temperature be too warm; yer skin be sticky with sweat and yer throat be quick t' parch.
freezing: Th' temperature be too cold; yer extremities be goin' numb as yer body struggles t' stay warm.
frostbitten: Ye feel th' sharp, cold pain o' frozen extremities.
{0?- {0}% chance t' pass each damage tick.}

fire: A dangerous open flame providin' heat and light.
honeyFungus: A parasitic tree fungus that can grow and spread on livin', decayin', and dead plant material.
tumblingTumbleweed: A dry and brittle tumblin' weed, broken off from its roots and spreadin' seeds in its meanderin' path.
animalDung: A seemingly fresh pile o' feces, excreted from an animal.
guano: Th' excrement o' a bat, thought t' be used as fertilizer.
wispDust: A smartly vanishin' pile o' glowin' dust, excreted from a ghostly wisp.
acid: A neon-green ooze; boilin' and bubblin' into th' ground.
